sub_title: Head of Art and History at Stedelijk Museum Schiedam
summary:
Catrien Schreuder is an art historian, specialized in post 1960 art, new media art and art criticism. She was co-writer of the publication 'De neo-avant-garde en de Nederlandse kunstkritiek 1958-1975' in 2015 and author of the book 'Pixels and Places' on the presentation of video art in urban public space, that was published in 2010. In Museum Boijmans Van Beuningen she specialized in museum education and public programming. She currently works as head of Art and History of the Stedelijk Museum Schiedam, leading the collections- and curatorial department of the museum. 

Specialties: New media art, art education, interpretation, research, editing, writing, video art in public space, art criticism, avant garde art of the 1960s and 1970s

projects.title: Arttube - Video's about Art & Design
projects.description: Five museums for modern and contemporary art have bundled their resources to expand the online video channel ArtTube into the largest collective video platform for art and design in the Netherlands and Belgium. The Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam, M HKA in Antwerp, Gemeentemuseum The Hague, De Pont in Tilburg and Museum Boijmans Van Beuningen in Rotterdam will be publishing videos on this channel during the coming three years. In this way, the museums can inform the public about art, collections and other museum matters from one central platform.

profile_positions.description: As head of the Art and History department I am leading the collections- and curatorial departments of the Stedelijk Museum Schiedam. The Stedelijk Museum Schiedam's public collection focuses on modern and contemporary art from the Netherlands as well as historic objects from Schiedam's history. As a head of Art and History I am responsible for conservation, acquisition and research of the museum's collections. Also I am in charge of the curatorial processes, (art)historical contents and research of the exhibitions and art and history programmes of the Stedelijk Museum Schiedam, leading a team of curators and initiating collaborations with co-curators from other fields of knowledge and affinity.
profile_positions.title: Head of Art and History

profile_positions.description:
As head of Collections and exhibitions Catrien Schreuder is responsible for the exhibitions programming and collection policy of the Stedelijk Museum Schiedam. 
The museum takes care of the art and history collections of the city of Schiedam and several private owners, including a CoBrA collection, Dutch art from the 1960s, contemporary Dutch art, and a collection of art and artefacts representing the history of Schiedam. 
The museums exhibition programme aims to connect people to art, history and each other, by presenting exhibitions around contemporary themes and in collaboration with people and partners in Schiedam, the Netherlands and abroad.
profile_positions.title: Head of Collections and Exhibitions

profile_positions.description: Co-founder and general board member of the Art Match Foundation, that aims to innovate museum education, enhance public engagement, stimulate and initiate interdisciplinary programmes and cooperation between museums in the Netherlands and abroad. Art Match is responsible for ARTtube and Art Rocks. ARTtube is the collective video platform of the Netherlands and Belgium, sharing high quality educative video content of over 25 museums. Art Rocks is a biannual event that promotes a meaningful crossover between art and popular music, that takes place in several museums spread all over the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: General board member

List of publications:
- 'Injections of art. Video works in semi-public places', SCB Journal (Screen City Biennial Stavenger, Norway): http://journal.screencitybiennial.org/2017/10/11/catrien-schreuder-article/
- Kunst = taal en rekenen. Drie jaar Boijmans Taal- en rekenprogramma, (met Wolf Brinkman, Elsje Miedema), Assen (Koninklijke Uitgeverij Van Gorkum) 2017. 
- 'What's Happening? De neo-avant-garde en de Nederlanse kunstkritiek 1958-1975' (met Jonneke Jobse), Rotterdam (NAi Uitgevers) 2015. Part of a series of publications on the history of Dutch art criticism since 1880 initiated and edited by Peter de Ruiter (Rijksuniversiteit Groningen) and Jonneke Jobse. 
- 'De kleine kunstkijker', Rotterdam 2013, a guide written with Deirdre Carasso on how to visit an art museum with children.
- 'Images versus self', tent. cat. Zwolle (Stedelijk Museum) 2011   
- 'Beautiful too. Hester Scheurwater's Video Art', tent.cat. Zwolle (Stedelijk Museum) 2010
- 'Pixels and Places. Video Art in Public Space', Rotterdam (Nai Publishers) 2010
- 'Het spel met stad en tijd. Twee videowerken voor de openbare ruimte', in: The Art of Matching tentoonstellingsbrochure Stichting Dziga, Nijmegen 2010  
- ‘Pour your body out. Een onderdompeling in een installatie van Pipilotti Rist’, in: Elixir. Het video organisme van Pipilotti Rist, Rotterdam / Helsinki (Museum Boijmans Van Beuningen / Kiasma Art Center) 2009 
- Exhibition review: ‘Web 2.0 onbegrensd’, nov 07 in Tubelight
- ‘Ongemakkelijk naakt. Performancekunst in de jaren zestig’, Jong Holland 19 (2003) 1. See also: http://www.jong-holland.nl/1-2003/samvat1-2003.htm
- ‘”I'm a beauty, I'm a virtual.” Supervrouwen in de maak’, Lover (2002) 3.
- Online publications: exhibition reviews of L.A. Raeven, Federico d’Orazio, Sixties and Michael Borremans at www.8weekly.nl; 2007
profile_positions.title: Art historical researcher and writer

profile_positions.description:
February 2011: curated a video art program for the urban screen of the art installation Between You and Me (Martin and Inge Riebeek), containing works by: Saskia Edens, Francis Alys, Wim Gijzen, Yvonne Oerlemans, Pascual Sisto, Junebum Park and Paulien Oltheten. 

2008-2010: in close collaboration with stichting Picos de Europa Catrien Schreuder has written the art historical publication 'Pixels and Places' on video art in public space. It has been be brought out in February 2010 by Nai publishers, Rotterdam.

Catrien Schreuder lectured on Pixels and Places at the following occasions:
- 27 November 2010: a lecture at the conference 'Mediatizing the City'  at Goldsmiths University, London
- 25 November 2010: a lecture at Strijp-S festival in Eindhoven
- 21 November 2010: a lecture at the conference 'Besides the screen' at Goldsmiths University, London 
- 1 October 2010: a lecture at the international symposium For Real, Maastricht
- 22 April 2010: a lecture at the symposium 'Van ledscherm naar mediafacade' at the BKKC Tilburg
- January - March 2010: six theoretical lectures on video art in public space, as part of a minor on video art in public space called 'Pixels and Places' at the Sint Joost Academy in Breda.
